newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit stuck in tight range on lack of interest.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit stuck in tight range on lack of interest.

text.p: The ringgit was stuck in a tight range towards the end of the Asian day on lack of trading interest ahead of Malaysia's annual budget on October 25, dealers said on Monday.
"There is hardly any interest. Trading is in a real tight range," said a dealer with a Kuala Lumpur-based bank.
He said there was mild ringgit buying in late afternoon trading, which moved dollar/ringgit by five points.
At 0900 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.5064/69 a dollar against 2.5064/75 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Friday.
But forecasts for the ringgit's movement were mixed.
Some said the ringgit would continue easing against the dollar, which is expected to remain strong against majors.
"It will move higher in response to the big dollar's movement," a Singapore-based European bank dealer said.
"But there is selling interest from funds around 2.5080 level, which may slow down the ringgit's decline," he said.
But others said it would be rangebound ahead of the annual budget to be unveiled on October 25.
"I think it will range-trade before the budget," a dealer with a Malaysian bank said. - Madhav Reddy (603-230 8911)
